abstracts.cdata!:
The project would consist of the
            following geophysical surveys and related work: (a) airmag
            survey of the prospective sedimentary areas; (b) gravity
            survey to cover selected traverses in areas identified in
            the airmag survey; (c) reprocessing of mineral airmag data;
            and (d) supervision and quality control of the airmag
            survey. The project would also provide the following
            technical assistance: (a) exploration consultants to help
            establish the petroleum unit, coordinate the various project
            components, produce a strategy and a promotion report on
            Zambia's geological prospects, and provide training to
            Zambian geologists; (b) legal consultants to draft petroleum
            legislation, prepare model exploration/production
            agreements, and assist the Government in negotiating with
            oil companies; (c) training of Zambian staff in petroleum
            geology and interpretation of geophysical surveys; and (d)
            equipment including vehicles, lab and office equipment.
